name: Dandy Lion Black Soap
description:
Traditional African black Soap with Shea Butter. Plastic packaging made from 100% recycled polyethylene plastic. Handmade in Ghana from: pure unrefined shea butter, virgin coconut oil, cocoa pod ashes. 100% Natural.

Through harvesting shea nuts and producing shea butter, Mrs Eugenia is able to provide dependable, well-paying, and supportive employment for almost 700 women and men in one of Ghana’s most poverty stricken areas.

name: Resin Necklace
description:
These sustainable necklaces are handmade in the Himalayan region of India. Resins from pines are dried, finely cut and polished to give a wooden effect. These beads are then sown neatly end to end in a thread.

Artisans working on these necklaces receive fair wages and are given help to develop their communities. By buying this necklace you are supporting fair trade and ensuring a dignified lifestyle for an entire community.

Length: 19"

name: Multi-Color Tear Necklace
description:
A cluster of colorful, pastel, jewel-tone, faceted beads clings to a smooth brass frame, and falls from a delicately beaded chain.

Handmade by low-income women artisans in New Delhi, India, who are part of a fair trade organization.

Measures 17” + 3” extender.

name: Mint Bib Necklace
description:
This necklace is comprised of handmade mint colored flat beads connected with silver rings.

Made by one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process. 
These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Length: 12.75"-13.75"

name: Grape Bib Necklace
description:
This is a beautiful dark grape color bib necklace made out of wood and connected with brass rings.

Made by one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process. 
These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Length: 13"-14"

name: Macrame Necklace
description:
A chunky and gorgeous beaded necklace with a black macrame and coconut shell button closure.  This is bound to dress up any outfit.

Made by one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process. These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Length: 10 1/2"

name: Mirage Scarves
description:
This product was handmade in India by a worker who was provided fair wages and safe working conditions.  Buying this product offers sustainability, hope, purpose and dignity.  It sustains their business and makes a stand against human trafficking.


Lightweight, sheer scarf made from viscose and batik printed.

name: Floral Block Print Scarf
description:
Made by a cooperative that targets young women with little or no education, since they are often the ones that experience the greatest amount of difficulty in finding work. They provide them training and a fair wage and work environment that they otherwise, most likely, wouldn't have received in other lines of work. 

Handmade block printed scarf with beautiful floral pattern. Stripes at end of scarf add a modern element to design. Scarfs are lightweight and made from 100% cotton.

name: Pom Infinity Scarf
description:
This lightweight, naturally dip-dyed circular scarf is made using a traditional batik technique and trimmed with soft, tiny poms along the edges for a more unique look.

Size: 20" W x 37" Drop

name: Nepali Woven Bracelet
description:
Pefect for any occasion, tiny multicolored glass beads are woven on soft cotton thread to create this beautiful and comfortable work of art.

Nepali women have been weaving beads traditionally for centuries.  This group of about 18 women work from a home workshop among small crop fields beneath a view of the Himalayas.  This co-op creates beautiful and timeless pieces that provide women with a sustainable income.

Made of woven glass beads and cotton thread.

Measures 7" around; rolls on most wrists.

name: Crocheted Bracelet
description:
Handmade by an artisan community made up of women from New Delhi, India and surrounding villages. They are provided fair wages, a safe work environment, and the preservation of valuable traditional skills. By supporting these local crafters, you are helping these artisans avoid migration for work, so they can remain in their villages to sustain the future of their families.

Each cuff is an earthy mix of crochet colored cotton cord adorned with a mix of brass and silver plated metal beads.

Made of cotton, brass, and silver-plated metal.

Measures 7.5" L.

name: Turquoise Coil Bracelet
description:
They say "a rising tide lifts all boats" and this coil bracelet will do just that - lifting your spirit with a playful design while lifting the women who crafted them out of poverty.  Each bracelet features a wrap beaded coil of turquoise glass beads at varying lengths and is accented with brass beads.

Mad of glass and brass beads on memory wire.

Measures 2.5" diameter; uncoils to fit most wrists.

Handmade in and fairly traded from India.

name: Silver Beaded Bracelet
description:
Handmade by an artisan community made up of women from New Delhi, India and surrounding villages.  They are provided fair wages, a safe work environment, and the preservation of valuable traditional skills.  By supporting these local crafters, you are helping these artisans avoid migration for work, so they can remain in their villages to sustain the future of their families.

Each bracelet features seven silver plated strands of beads.

Measures 7" L x 1" W with 1.5" L extender.

name: Block Print Medallion Scarf
description:
This comfy cotton scarf will become a natural part of your everyday dress!  Features block printing for a stylish look.

Handmade in and fairly traded from India by an innovative fair trade, not-for-profit organization which combines the experience of running a business with a variety of support programs designed to effect real, meaningful, and lasting change in the lives of low-income women in India. The organization works with 480 artisans who are organized into 14 independent co-operatives which produce high-quality women's apparel and accessories. Being in charge of their own businesses, the women learn valuable skills and are able to earn a living and support their families. In addition, programs offer educational and enrichment opportunities designed to help the artisans overcome personal, cultural and financial obstacles. Empowered with independence and self-confidence, these women become agents of change. 

Made of 100% cotton.

Measures 18" W x 72" L.

name: Raw Silk Scarf
description:
This handwoven raw silk scarf adds the perfect pop of color to any wardrobe.

Handmade in and fairly traded from Vietnam Craftbeauty by an all-women artisan organization aimed at helping rural women earn a regular monthly salary to support themselves and their families. Working with a variety of fabrics in their native Vietnam, the artisans of Craftbeauty have managed to create opportunity where before prospects looked dim. They have a workshop where women can come together to work, but also have opportunities for women to craft from home. Now the primary source of income in their village, these women earn more than three times what they made farming rice, allowing them to provide a better future for themselves and their families.

Made of 100% silk.

Measures 67" L x 15.5" W; fringe measures 2.5".

name: Shimmer Scarf
description:
A feathery blend of silk and cotton makes this scarf soft and dreamy to wear.  Handmade in and fairly traded from Vietnam Craftbeauty by an all-women artisan organization aimed at helping rural women earn a regular monthly salary to support themselves and their families. Working with a variety of fabrics in their native Vietnam, the artisans of Craftbeauty have managed to create opportunity where before prospects looked dim. They have a workshop where women can come together to work, but also have opportunities for women to craft from home. Now the primary source of income in their village, these women earn more than three times what they made farming rice, allowing them to provide a better future for themselves and their families.

Made of silk and cotton blend.

Measures 71" L x 23.5" W.

name: Faceted Drop Necklace
description:
This elegant long necklace was made by one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process.  These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Olive Green/Brownish color, Length:  14"-17"

name: Fresh Roasted Fair Trade Coffee
description:
Roasted when you order, this fair trade coffee is locally roasted and directly traded with the farmer to ensure fair wages.  It is specifically blended for Dignity Regained and is made up of Ethiopian and Brazilian beans.

Smooth, bright and complex with a slight nutty taste.

1lb bag, shipped on Fridays

name: Wrapped Bracelet
description:
Made from thick cotton bands and metal beads.

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

SIZE: 20" x 0.25" with two closure options.

name: Wooden Charm Bracelets
description:
Made from the seeds of a Tulsi tree, these beads are commonly used in India for meditative purposes to align mind, body and soul. Each bracelet features a metal charm.

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

Size: Unstretched Diameter 2.25”

name: Yellow Messenger
description:
Was $36, now 10% off.

This yellow messenger bag has hand-blocked fabric, embroidered embellishments and purple peek-a-boo accents.  Flap and button closure.

Made by one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process. 
These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.


Materials: 100% Cotton, hand-block printed fabric
12"tall, approx 37" drop

name: Swazi Disc Earrings
description:
In Swaziland, basket-weaving skills are handed down from mother to daughter.  Adorn yourself in hand-crafted artistry and colorful sophistication.

With an academic background in development, this rural women's group believes that creating an income generating opportunity for the women will help them become happier, healthier individuals - women who could take charge of their lives. The small business that started with 12 women has to date worked with and trained more than 890 women. Their products are known for their beauty as well as the story of the women behind each product. 

Made of sisal.

Measure 1.5" L.

name: Yellow Gypsy Earrings
description:
Elegant and unique, this amber colored glass disc sets inside a silver cone accented with a little turquoise stone.  

Made by Survivors, an int’l nonprofit which employs and educates survivors of slavery and other human rights abuses, including women and children living in extreme poverty.     Their programs create jobs in highly respected professions with high wages that develop business and leadership skills. 

Approx 2"

name: Fan Earrings
description:
Made by a one of the co-ops in India and Nepal who employ over 600 economically disadvantaged artisans. These women are trained in the trade and manage every step in the production process. These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Length: 2"

name: Emerald Drop Earrings
description:
Round silver earrings with swaying emerald color stones.

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.  A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

SIZE: 1.75" x 1"

MATERIALS: Brass, Semi precious stone
Nickel and lead free

name: Vintage Stone Earring
description:
Sophisticated earrings with an elegant feel. Unrefined brass with semi-precious stones surrounded by a simple vintage pattern.

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 


Nickel and lead Free

name: Copper and Brass Wrapped Earrings
description:
Artisans use upcycled wire, copper and glass beads to create bold geometric jewelry designs that are trendy, yet earthy. May patina over time to create natural antique effect, or polish to keep it sleek and shiny.

This product was handmade in India by women who were given fair wages and safe working conditions.  Buying this product offers sustainability, hope, purpose and dignity.  It sustains their business and makes a stand against human trafficking.

Size: 1.75"
Nickel and lead free

name: Believe and Inspire Necklace
description:
Engraved with the words "believe" and "inspire" these silver plates hang from a chain that is approximately 20" long.

Made by Kiej de los Bosques which is a fair trade enterprise that collaborates with five rural artisan groups throughout Guatemala. Most of the women artisans live in very small villages where there are no jobs. Before Kiej they were forced to leave their children behind to take work in larger cities. For them, the income generated by Kiej is a dream come true, an opportunity to keep their families together and to send their children to school for the first time. A strong focus on community development, social entrepreneurship, and fair wages has vastly improved the lives of its eighty women artisans and their families.

name: Paisley Silk Scarf
description:
Traditional Indian motifs of paisleys and arches are hand-printed and dyed onto this finely woven 100% silk scarf.

Pushpanjali is a fair trade organization based in Agra, India.  Since its establishment in 1982, they have provided marketing and financial support to small and marginalized producers to improve their living and working conditions. They support educational and medical programs in rural villages – allowing girls to attend school that otherwise could not afford to.

Made of 100% silk.  Brown with blue accents

Measures 68" L x 20" W.

Handmade in and fairly traded from India

name: Stone Bracelet
description:
Oval stone inset in brass cuff bracelet with an antique finish. Simple and elegant design. 

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

Color varies

name: Vintage Journal
description:
Handmade of recycled cotton, this vintage journal design appeals to everyone.  Cover features line art with a repeat pattern on the spine and back. Cord with tassel wraps journal closed, keeping it neat and stylish.

Wasim was born and raised in Sanganer village, in west Rajasthan, India.  His family has been in the paper making industry for over 80 years, and he inherited the art from his elders.    Eco-Friendly Papers uses recycled cotton rags and converts the raw paper into these beautiful journals without the aid of having machinery.

Size: 5" x 7"

name: Brass and Copper Ripple Cuff
description:
This adjustable cuff bracelet has an intricately carved floral design. The copper and brass sections create a multi-color look. The bracelet was handmade by artisans in India following Fair Trade practices.

Made by Noah’s Ark India. In 1986, Noah’s Ark was established to provide integrity, welfare and better living conditions for very poor artisans in the villages of Moradabad, India. In addition to fair wages and business support, Noah’s Ark provides an opportunity to acquire life insurance, medical care and a facility for their children’s education. There are 28 small artisan groups whose lives have been significantly impacted by improved living conditions and increased market opportunities for their craft. There is also a wonderful ripple effect in their communities as their improved wages get invested in other community businesses.

name: Ivy Cuff
description:
This lovely cuff has been embossed with a grape vine design on the front surface. The design is darker than the rest of the cuff, which is of a golden color.

A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

Brass
2” tall at the center and 0.5” tall on edges, adjustable width

name: Ikat Jacket
description:
Was $39. Now 10% off! 

Hand woven Ikat print, cap sleeve, cropped jacket. 
Contrasting block print lining. 
Single button closure at center.

Lovingly made by women in India who were once living below the poverty line. They now have a sustainable income, benefits like childcare, annual medical checkups, overtime pay, and retirement plans.  Every chain in the production process is completely managed by the women, and many become socially and politically active in their larger communities.

name: Polka Dot Clutch
description:
Fanciful and colorful all natural black wool zip top bag is fully lined with multicolor applique zip top and felt ball zipper pull.

Made by survivors in Nepal
5" x 8.5"

name: Brown Beaded Wrap Bracelet
description:
Made by Escaping Child Marriage, a group of brave and talented women artisans in the Himalayan mountainous region of India. The cooperative helps women become independent after being victims of child marriage.

By supporting these artisans through fair trade, you are helping this group of women become independent, self-sufficient and live a life they deserve.

This multi-wrap brown beaded bracelet is basic yet a statement at the same time.

name: Carved Leaf Bracelet
description:
A young girl named Sana called Ana Art Group and explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.   A small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, has grown to  a large community with improvements in education, health and in the environment. 

This is a Fair Trade product made by artisans in India. The artisans are compensated fairly for their work, and are given development help to help their communities rise above poverty.

This metal cuff has been carved with leaf designs.

name: Green Floral Journal
description:
These 8.5"x11" journals are hard-bound and sturdy, decorated with a floral printed design on the cover and an embroidered spine. Filled with paper made from recycled cotton scraps.

Wasim was born and raised in Sanganer village, in west Rajasthan, India. His family has been in the paper making industry for over 80 years, and he inherited the art from his elders.   Eco-Friendly Papers uses recycled cotton rags and converts the raw paper into these beautiful journals without the aid of having machinery.

name: Owl T
description:
This charming t-shirt is made by Freeset.  Freeset was founded in 2001 and employs women who once worked in the notorious red-light district of Calcutta, providing an escape from a life of virtual slavery. Childcare, health care and literacy programs are provided so artisans can earn a fair wage in a healthy work environment, while building a better future for themselves and their daughters.

Made with 100% fairly traded organic cotton

name: India on my Heart T-shirt
description:
Made in the USA by Alternative Apparel, this T-Shirt is printed with water based ink on 100% organic cotton super soft T-shirts.        Made sustainably with fair working conditions this t-shirt makes a statement about human trafficking in India. 

T-shirts are unisex sizing

name: HOPE & LOVE Cuff
description:
Make a statement with this beautiful inspirational cuff bracelet! 

Made of silver-plated brass. 

Measures 2" W x 2.5" diameter. 

Handmade in and fairly traded from India.

name: Stone Rings
description:
Was $16, now $12, this ring features a smooth finish on assorted stones with a classic silver braided edge around the setting.

This product was handmade by an artisan in India who was given fair wages and safe working conditions.  Buying this product offers sustainability, hope, purpose and dignity.  It sustains their business and makes a stand against human trafficking.

Setting is approximately 1" L x 3/4" W.  Adjustable.

Silver plated brass.  Due to the nature of this products, stones can have a variant in color.

name: Wood Wrap Bracelet
description:
Sassy, spiraled bracelets with beads of wood, glass, and seed. Tones of red, brown, and turquoise.

Made by Diane’s Paperworks. Through developing new innovative designs, raising the standard of quality, linking local artisans with the global marketplace, and advocating for sustainable development, Diane’s Paperworks has been able to become a company with a conscience. They provide life changing help for young men, teaching them the skills of screen-printing on hand made paper, job training, housing, a basic literacy course, and future job placement. Beyond that, since most women have never been beyond a 5th grade education, Diane’s Paperworks works along side them to teach them math and reading skills. Women are also empowered by encouraging them to make decisions in the community.

name: Magazine Necklaces
description:
Handmade from rolled magazines, these necklaces provide a livable wage to women in Indonesia and prevent them from being victims of human trafficking.

Available in short or long made with a variety of sizes and colored beads. 

Short necklaces are approximately 26" long
Long necklaces are approximately 54" - 60" long.

(Due to the nature of this product, colors, length and bead sizes vary)

name: Night Owl Journal
description:
Two big owls on the front cover and one owl on the back, embossed on cruelty-free leather. Tree-free cotton paper inside. Refillable, 72 pages.

Size: 4" x 6"

name: Plaid Shirt Dress
description:
Was $45, now 10% off!

Oh-so-cute fitted Plaid Shirt Dress!
Short-sleeved, knee length with collar. 
Mother of pearl buttons down the front. 
Attached belt with two front pockets.

Lovingly made by women in India who were once living below the poverty line. They now have a sustainable income, benefits like childcare, annual medical checkups, overtime pay, and retirement plans.  Every chain in the production process is completely managed by the women, and many become socially and politically active in their larger communities.

name: Sisal Drop Earrings
description:
Women in Swaziland create these beautiful earrings woven from sisal using a local, time honored fine-coiling technique.  All steps of the production are carried out by hand, including the cleaning, dyeing, and spinning of the naturally grown fiber.

Made of sisal.

Measure 2.5" L x 0.75" W.  

Handmade in and fairly traded from Swaziland.

name: Small Change Necklace
description:
Layers of circular, silver metal pieces combined to create a small triangular tier of coin shapes. Simple and elegant in design.

Made by the Ana Art Group in India. What began as a small artisan group working from tiny, conjested work spaces in Old Delhi, is now a large community with an increase in education and improvements in health and environmental impacts.

Chain 30"

name: Cotton Swing Skirt
description:
Was $32, now 10% off!

This flattering cotton skirt is flowing and welcome alternative to shorts when the weather gets warm.

Assisi Garments is a women's non-profit in India run by an order of Franciscan nuns who employ and care for 120 disadvantaged and handicapped women. Assisi's garments are made from 100% organic cotton, which is farmed locally by a group of 300 organic cotton farmers in Maharashtar India.  Each garment is lovingly produced from seed to sewing machine.

Made of 96% organic cotton and 4% lycra; dyed with environmentally friendly dyes.

Color: stone

Handmade in and fairly traded from India.

name: Cotton Straight Skirt
description:
Was $32, now 10% off!

This fitted skirt which features a wide waistband and a slim silhouette is a great staple for any closet.  Great in the summer with sandals and great for fall with tights and boots.

Assisi Garments is a women's non-profit in India run by an order of Franciscan nuns who employ and care for 120 disadvantaged and handicapped women. Assisi's garments are made from 100% organic cotton, which is farmed locally by a group of 300 organic cotton farmers in Maharashtar India.  Each garment is lovingly produced from seed to sewing machine.

Fitted at hips, back zipper, below the knee.  100% cotton.

Fair Trade
India

These groups provide benefits like childcare, annual medical check-ups, overtime pay, and community development programs.

Honor the friends in your life with a gift that says how much they inspire and mean to you.  Set of two bracelets.

Made of metal beads and charms and waxed cotton thread. 

Handmade in and fairly traded from Guatemala.

name: Byzantine Earrings
description: Three rows of opaque seed beads arc around a frame of metallic barrel beads. Measures 2” long. With hinged, easel backs. Handmade by low-income women artisans in India, who are improving their lives through their work in a women’s cooperative.

name: Dainty Pearl Drops
description:
Dainty sterling silver earring wires hold a delicate pearl.

Measures ½” long.

Handmade by artisans who are part of a fair trade organization in Bali, Indonesia.

name: Magazine Earrings
description:
Handmade from rolled magazines, these earrings provide a livable wage to women in Indonesia and prevent them from being victims of human trafficking.

Available in big, medium and small sizes.

name: Magazine Keychain
description:
Handmade by women in Indonesia who are a part of Beads of Java.  These keychains are cleverly made from rolled magazines.         Beads of Java exists to give hope, purpose, and a greater quality of life.  These efforts prevent them from being victims of human trafficking.

Approximately 3 1/2"

(Due to the nature of this product, colors, length and bead sizes vary)

name: Mini Journals
description:
Great for your purse or your pocket, these mini journal books are created with recycled cotton rags with either an embroidered or printed pattern on the covers. Quality tree-free paper and a ribbon tie closure.

Make sure to specify the color you love.

name: Rooted in the Past Journal
description:
This beautiful journal is made entirely of recycled cotton paper, incorporating recycled Indian newspaper on the cover design. The cotton used to make the paper is collected from the textile industry, turned into a pulp, and then turned into sheets of paper. This means they are tree-free and eco friendly!

The back reads "Rooted in the past, growing towards the future".

Materials: Cotton Paper, recycled newspaper
Size: 5” x 7”
Due to the nature of this product design details may vary

name: Tribal Art Necklace
description:
This vibrant necklace is made of multi-colored glass beads knotted together into a multi-string necklace.  It is lighter in weight than it looks, sitting comfortably around your neck.

A group of brave and talented women artisans are a part of a cooperative in the Himalayan mountainous region of India and create this beautiful, sustainable jewelry. The cooperative helps women become independent after being victims of child marriage. Some of the artisans even have a full-time job outside of their shelter and are able to make the jewelry in their spare time.  They also learn how to weave, cut, tailor, and other various artisan skills.  All of their work reflects their perseverance, talent and ethnic art of the region.

By supporting these artisans through fair trade, you are helping this group of women become independent, self-sufficient and live a life they deserve.



Length: 17.5"

name: VHS Wristlet
description:
This fun wristlet is made of cotton woven with recycled video tape. It closes with a zipper at the top and has a convenient wrist strap to grab when you're running out the door.  Big enough to hold cards, change, makeup, or a cell phone.  Perfect for everyday or a night out.

Materials: Cotton and recycled VHS/cassette tape

Size: 6.5" x 4.5"

name: Coin Purse
description:
A smooth silk coin purse to keep your essentials in.

Approximately 30% of the women who made these products have been rescued from slavery and are being trained and developed in language, design, machining and management. The desire of this project is to build sustainable businesses that will change the lives of the Cambodian people and bring hope where there has been despair. We are training and developing local Cambodians to grow and develop the businesses.

name: Nocturnal Peace
description:
Celebrate the tranquility of the night with three strands of swirly black and gray beads strung on knotted cord. Adjusts from 18 inches to 32 inches.

Crafted by survivors of human trafficking at the Princess Home in Nepal.

name: Orange Flower
description:
Spring into summer with these cute, lightweight, orange earrings.

Lovingly made by women in India.

Length: 2 1/2"
Materials: Bone

name: Tribal Mystique Necklace
description:
Truly unique, this 40" long signature necklace combines glass beads and wood beads intricately woven on knotted cord. The selling of this necklace helps to send child survivors and children born into brothel communities to attend school for the first time. 

This jewelry is ethical and sustainable, made by survivors of slavery in Nepal who are earning a sustainable income, offered dignity, and a bright future free of slavery.

name: Strength Necklace
description:
This cool piece is for men and women who want to celebrate their strength in times of adversity. The pendant is made from a hollow bone. The knotted cord adjusts so that it can worn short like a choker or as long as 28 inches.

Made in Nepal by strong survivors of human trafficking.

name: Printed Cotton Stole
description:
100% cotton stole, block-printed with natural dyes. Lightweight and soft. Comes in 2 color variations - Black, Green.

Lovingly made by Abdul and his wife Fatima in the northwestern region of India. Because of severe drought, this region is not farmable. Artisans must use crafts to earn an income and support the local economy of the region. 

Size: 20" x 70"

name: Rainbow Glass Bracelet
description:
This 6 strand bracelet of lime, indigo, gold, coral, maroon and teal are made from recycled glass. Due to each piece's individuality, all sizes and lengths are approximate. Bracelets have clear elastic band. (~7.5")

This bracelet was lovingly made by Comfort.  She dreams of saving enough money to build a house so she can move out of the two-roomed house that she and her family currently live in. She would like to one day open a school where she could teach bead making to underprivileged children. Comfort partners with the Fair Trade Center in Odumase-Krobo where she receives fair wages and can enjoy working from home.

name: Spirit of Africa Necklace
description:
This mixture of Lime, Gold, Coral and black are made from recycled glass. Due to each piece's individuality, all sizes and lengths are approximate. (~19")

These recycled glass beads were handmade in Ghana by Grace Joe.  The money she earns helps to keep her nephew in school and covers the food bills for her son, who lives away from home and is training to be a mechanic. She would like to save money so she can build her own family home which will give her peace of mind, and set up a shop where she can sell her own beads directly to customers. 

Grace Joe also trained her daughter in the production of these beaded projects and she co-founded a training center which provides employment to more than 10 young women who struggle to make ends meet. Most of the women, aged 18 upwards, have completed junior secondary school. The center provides training in product assembly and a fair living wage.

name: Color Ray Earrings
description:
Brass wrapped with colorful cotton threads measuring 2 1/2". 

Lovingly made by women in India.

name: Braided Cuff
description:
Silver-colored cuff with embossed braid pattern. Flexible to fit wrist.

Handmade by artisans in Jama Masjid, Old Delhi, India by Ana Art Group.  Ana Art Group received an email from a young girl named Sana living in Jama Masjid, Old Delhi, India. She explained that her family and members of the community make jewelry, but are being mistreated by their few current employers.  

What began as a small artisan group working from tiny, congested work spaces in Old Delhi, is now a large community with an increase in education and improvements in health and environmental impacts.

name: Sun Medallion Earrings
description:
Circular silver-colored earrings etched with intricate design of radial symmetry. Approx 1 1/2" in diameter.

Lovingly made by artisans in Jama Masjid, Old Delhi, India.

name: Kala Raksha Clutch
description:
Big enough for the essentials but not as bulky as a shoulder bag. Cotton clutch has a hand embroidered brick colored base accented with blue trim made with traditional wood block printing methods.   Fully lined, inside zipper compartment and pocket.  Measures 11" x 8.5" with a snap closure. 

“Kala Raksha” means “Protecting art”.  Kala Raksha Vidyalaya is a school in north western India that provides vocational training in the traditional art forms to the local youth. The aim is for young people to practice and preserve traditional Kutch embroidery.

Your purchase of this clutch provides direct financial help to support this school, which nurtures many of the art forms used to create these products. Furthermore, it provides the artisans with information necessary to create more fashionable and marketable products, so they have a better chance to compete against big factories.
